It is your choice not to work as is the lifestyle you have chosen to live. A 7.8k rental, 1k dinners, 1k monthly clothing spend, monthly hair growth
supplements, weekly massages, 700 hotel rooms etc.
This has come at expense of and sacrificing,  stopping monthly kids college contributions, potentially moving them back to public school, and change
in their living situation.
That is a trade off that does not make sense to me, but that’s your choice.
I’m looking forward to seeing how the math works out and your logic in mediation.
You have felt comfortable to make those decisions.

Account 9039 just has 10k in Sbux stock and less than 500 in cash as I outlined in the document.
Below is inflammatory and implies I misled you. Your “” again is reason why no conversations should occur as you will document words and try use
them against me.
Obviously you knew about the other unvested RSU account which is clearly not in the x9039 as I disclosed it in the discovery. I don’t have access to
those shares until they vest. They would never vest if I left SBUX. Some were granted before the divorce filing and some after.
Agree post divorce shares granted and vesting will be deposited into account 9039. I will move those out immediately so need to adjust the language in
the stipulation.
Yes we can memorialize everything including your spend from the jt BofA account and fidelity account in violation of the order.
I still have not seen statements from June July and Aug from msft fidelity account.
Based on this tone and accusations I no longer feel comfortable with assuming you will repay me the 3.7k that you used in violation or other
reimbursements I have requested totalling over 7k and would like to request I get 27k from the 50k redistribution.

From: rob.moyer@gmail.com <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Friday, August 30, 2024 9:17 AM
To: 'christine moyer' <Christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Subject: Stipulation re: Fidelity Accounts
So... I made a minor correction noted with track changes, a simple “his” vs “her” thing.  See attached.  Other than that, we are mostly good to go
except for the questions below.
With regard to your x9039 account, are you leaving the amount in the first exhibit like we discussed (governed by the freeze order) but moving the
remainder of the stock in the second exhibit?  I am not sure I understood that you had another 46k in RSUs just sitting around in that account you
had created before the mediation. I thought you just had the 10k in Sbux stock you disclosed yesterday that were “easy to track.” If your RSUs were
granted during our marriage, they are generally considered marital property and are subject to division. Were you going to mention those? I think that
would be the same as stock and we would not want to co-mingle that with the predistribution. But this is all news to me anyway. Just let me know.
Also, do we want to insert amounts transferred into the stipulation so we can memorialize the predistributions?
No. 1 Exhibit
No. 2 Exhibit
Message 3857 of 4024
I did not accuse you of anything. I said I did not know. That is not an accusation. If I accused you, please simply capture it here. Because you say it
does not make it true. Make it true by actually cutting and pasting my accusation in this thread. You won’t, because it didn’t happen.
I asked for a simple clarification. One that you admitted would require an update now. So in pointing that out to you, and even as you acknowledge
that we need to update the stipulation, you go back on your word and say I made accusations.
I would prefer we walk this back. If you insist on going nuclear for asking about a correction that needs to be made I don’t understand. It feels like an
overreaction and misdirection by you to a mistake that I identified and you agreed to change.
Why go nuclear and fall back to threats as always?

Conner.
I was grateful, but 90 minutes was NOT a visit. Given the earliest I see AD is the middle of Sept. I'm trying to figure out how we can communicate
better.
Please work with me because the math this summer works out like this:
- I got 7.3 visits in total or 43 hours over 120 days this summer.
- That is about 2.5 hours/week and/or about 10.75 hours/month.
- Hours with Dad vs. hours with Mom work out to be 43 vs. 2,837
- You had every holiday, international trip, and the month of July
- Legally speaking, custody sits as 1.5% with Me vs. 98.5% with you
- The missing 5.5 hours on Sat is actually 13% of my whole summer
- By comparison, that 13% would be like you losing  a full 16 days
Do you still need me to ask Jennifer to verify what Adrian said, or will you do that? And if she does, will it even matter to you? I don't want to put
him in the middle again if it doesn't.
